dt: {bc}to undertake without leave or clear justification {bc}{sx|dare||}
{bc}to expect or assume especially with confidence
{bc}to suppose to be true without proof
{bc}to act or proceed {a_link|presumptuously} or on a {a_link|presumption}
{bc}to go beyond what is right or proper

et: Middle English, from Late Latin & Anglo-French; Anglo-French {it}presumer{/it}, from Late Latin {it}praesumere{/it} to dare, from Latin, to anticipate, assume, from {it}prae-{/it} + {it}sumere{/it} to take {ma}{mat|consume|}{/ma}
shortdef: to undertake without leave or clear justification : dare
to expect or assume especially with confidence
to suppose to be true without proof

dt.t: After the earthquake several people were missing and {it}presumed dead{/it}.
